Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor broke up Bowden Francis' no-hit bid with a tying homer leading off the ninth inning, Francisco Alvarez added a three-run shot and the New York Mets scored six times in their last at-bat to beat the Toronto Blue Jays 6-2 on Wednesday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Rogers Centre in Toronto, Ontario, with an attendance of 29,399.
Others: The Mets won the current series 2-1, with the Blue Jays winning game 1 and the Mets winning games 2 and 3.
